oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eugene C. Lewis mausoleum at Mt. Olivet, Nashville, Tennessee, 1978 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The gravesite of Major Eugene C. Lewis at Mount Olivet Cemetery in Nashville, Tennessee, with a pyramid and two sphinxes. Lewis was an early director of the Nashville Parks and Recreation Department, and he contributed to the development of Centennial Park and Shelby Park, among others. Lewis was also an industrial engineer for the Nashville, Chattanooga & St. Louis Railroad. He championed the construction of the Parthenon replica for the Tennessee Centennial Exposition of 1897 for the 100th anniversary of the statehood. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lewis, Eugene C., 1845-1917
Mount Olivet Cemetery (Nashville, Tenn.)
